Hebrew: דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֣ה ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָיָ֗ה אֶל־מִיכָה֙ הַמֹּ֣רַשְׁתִּ֔י בִּימֵ֥י יוֹתָ֛ם אָחָ֥ז יְחִזְקִיָּ֖ה מַלְכֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה אֲשֶׁר־חָזָ֥ה עַל־שֹׁמְר֖וֹן וִירֽוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> that came to Micah the Morashtite, who prophesied concerning Samaria and Jerusalem in the reigns of Kings Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah of Judah.
Transliteration: devar-yehovah asher hayah el-miykhah hamorashetiy viymey yvotam achaz yechizekiyah malekhey yehudah asher-chazah al-shomervon viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ֙ עַמִּ֣ים כֻּלָּ֔ם הַקְשִׁ֖יבִי אֶ֣רֶץ וּמְלֹאָ֑הּ וִיהִי֩ אֲדֹנָ֨י יֱהֹוִ֤ה בָּכֶם֙ לְעֵ֔ד אֲדֹנָ֖י מֵהֵיכַ֥ל קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
Listen, all you peoples,
Give heed, O earth, and all it holds;
And let the Sovereign GOD be your accuser—
The Sovereign from the holy abode.
Transliteration: shimeu amiym khulam hakeshiyviy erets umeloah viyhiy adonay yehovih vakhem leed adonay meheykhal kׇdeshvo

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה יֹצֵ֣א מִמְּקוֹמ֑וֹ וְיָרַ֥ד וְדָרַ֖ךְ עַל־[בָּ֥מֳתֵי] (במותי) אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
For lo! GOD
Is coming forth from the heavenly dwelling-place—
To come down and stride
Upon the heights of the earth.
Transliteration: khiy-hineh yehovah yotse mimekvomvo veyarad vedarakhe al-[vamotey] (vmvty) arets

Hebrew: וְנָמַ֤סּוּ הֶֽהָרִים֙ תַּחְתָּ֔יו וְהָעֲמָקִ֖ים יִתְבַּקָּ֑עוּ כַּדּוֹנַג֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י הָאֵ֔שׁ כְּמַ֖יִם מֻגָּרִ֥ים בְּמוֹרָֽד׃
Translated:
The mountains shall melt underfoot
And the valleys burst open—
Like wax before fire,
Like water cascading down a slope.
Transliteration: venamasu hehariym tachetayv vehaamakiym yitevakau khadvonag mifeney haesh khemayiim mugariym vemvorad

Hebrew: בְּפֶ֤שַׁע יַֽעֲקֹב֙ כׇּל־זֹ֔את וּבְחַטֹּ֖אות בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מִֽי־פֶ֣שַׁע יַעֲקֹ֗ב הֲלוֹא֙ שֹֽׁמְר֔וֹן וּמִי֙ בָּמ֣וֹת יְהוּדָ֔ה הֲל֖וֹא יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated:
All this is for the transgression of Jacob,
And for the sins of the House of Israel.
What is the transgression of Jacob
But Samaria,
And what the shrines of Judah
But Jerusalem?
Transliteration: vefesha yaakov khׇl-zot uvechatovt veyt yisherael miy-fesha yaakov halvo shomervon umiy vamvot yehudah halvo yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֥י שֹׁמְר֛וֹן לְעִ֥י הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה לְמַטָּ֣עֵי כָ֑רֶם וְהִגַּרְתִּ֤י לַגַּי֙ אֲבָנֶ֔יהָ וִיסֹדֶ֖יהָ אֲגַלֶּֽה׃
Translated:
So I will turn Samaria
Into a ruin in open country,
Into ground for planting vineyards;
For I will tumble her stones into the valley
And lay her foundations bare.
Transliteration: veshametiy shomervon leiy hashadeh lemataey kharem vehigaretiy lagay avaneyha viysodeyha agaleh

Hebrew: וְכׇל־פְּסִילֶ֣יהָ יֻכַּ֗תּוּ וְכׇל־אֶתְנַנֶּ֙יהָ֙ יִשָּׂרְפ֣וּ בָאֵ֔שׁ וְכׇל־עֲצַבֶּ֖יהָ אָשִׂ֣ים שְׁמָמָ֑ה כִּ֠י מֵאֶתְנַ֤ן זוֹנָה֙ קִבָּ֔צָה וְעַד־אֶתְנַ֥ן זוֹנָ֖ה יָשֽׁוּבוּ׃
Translated:
All her sculptured images shall be smashed,
And all her prostitute’s wealth be burned,
And I will make a waste heap of all her idols,
For they were amassed from fees for prostitution,
And they shall become prostitute’s fees again.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-fesiyleyha yukhatu vekhׇl-etenaneyha yisharefu vaesh vekhׇl-atsaveyha ashiym shemamah khiy meetenan zvonah kivatsah vead-etenan zvonah yashuvu

Hebrew: עַל־זֹאת֙ אֶסְפְּדָ֣ה וְאֵילִ֔ילָה אֵילְכָ֥ה (שילל) [שׁוֹלָ֖ל] וְעָר֑וֹם אֶעֱשֶׂ֤ה מִסְפֵּד֙ כַּתַּנִּ֔ים וְאֵ֖בֶל כִּבְנ֥וֹת יַעֲנָֽה׃
Translated:
Because of this I will lament and wail;
I will go stripped and naked!
I will lament as sadly as the jackals,
As mournfully as the ostriches.
Transliteration: al-zot esefedah veeyliylah eylekhah (shyll) [shvolal] vearvom eesheh misefed khataniym veevel khivenvot yaanah

Hebrew: כִּ֥י אֲנוּשָׁ֖ה מַכּוֹתֶ֑יהָ כִּי־בָ֙אָה֙ עַד־יְהוּדָ֔ה נָגַ֛ע עַד־שַׁ֥עַר עַמִּ֖י עַד־יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated:
For the nation’s wound is incurable,
It has reached Judah,
It has spread to the gate of my people,
To Jerusalem.
Transliteration: khiy anushah makhvoteyha khiy-vaah ad-yehudah naga ad-shaar amiy ad-yerushala͏im

Hebrew: בְּגַת֙ אַל־תַּגִּ֔ידוּ בָּכ֖וֹ אַל־תִּבְכּ֑וּ בְּבֵ֣ית לְעַפְרָ֔ה עָפָ֖ר (התפלשתי) [הִתְפַּלָּֽשִׁי]׃
Translated:
Tell it not in Gath,
Refrain from weeping;
In Beth-leaphrah,
Strew dust over your [head].
Transliteration: vegat al-tagiydu vakhvo al-tivekhu veveyt leaferah afar (htflshty) [hitefalashiy]

Hebrew: עִבְרִ֥י לָכֶ֛ם יוֹשֶׁ֥בֶת שָׁפִ֖יר עֶרְיָה־בֹ֑שֶׁת לֹ֤א יָֽצְאָה֙ יוֹשֶׁ֣בֶת צַֽאֲנָ֔ן מִסְפַּד֙ בֵּ֣ית הָאֵ֔צֶל יִקַּ֥ח מִכֶּ֖ם עֶמְדָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Pass on, inhabitants of Shaphir!
Did not the inhabitants of Zaanan
Have to go forth naked in shame?
There is lamentation in Beth-ezel—
It will withdraw its support from you.
Transliteration: iveriy lakhem yvoshevet shafiyr ereyah-voshet lo yatseah yvoshevet tsaanan misefad veyt haetsel yikach mikhem emedatvo

Hebrew: כִּֽי־חָ֥לָֽה לְט֖וֹב יוֹשֶׁ֣בֶת מָר֑וֹת כִּֽי־יָ֤רַד רָע֙ מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה לְשַׁ֖עַר יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated:
Though the inhabitants of Maroth
Hoped for good,
Yet disaster from GOD descended
Upon the gate of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: khiy-chalah letvov yvoshevet marvot khiy-yarad ra meet yehovah leshaar yerushala͏im

Hebrew: רְתֹ֧ם הַמֶּרְכָּבָ֛ה לָרֶ֖כֶשׁ יוֹשֶׁ֣בֶת לָכִ֑ישׁ רֵאשִׁ֨ית חַטָּ֥את הִיא֙ לְבַת־צִיּ֔וֹן כִּי־בָ֥ךְ נִמְצְא֖וּ פִּשְׁעֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Hitch the steeds to the chariot,
Inhabitant of Lachish!
It is the beginning
Of Fair Zion’s guilt;
Israel’s transgressions
Can be traced to you!
Transliteration: retom hamerekhavah larekhesh yvoshevet lakhiysh reshiyt chatat hiy levat-tsiyyvon khiy-vakhe nimetseu fisheey yisherael

Hebrew: לָכֵן֙ תִּתְּנִ֣י שִׁלּוּחִ֔ים עַ֖ל מוֹרֶ֣שֶׁת גַּ֑ת בָּתֵּ֤י אַכְזִיב֙ לְאַכְזָ֔ב לְמַלְכֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Truly, you must give a farewell gift
To Moresheth-gath.
The houses of Achzib are
To the kings of Israel
Like a spring that fails.
Transliteration: lakhen titeniy shiluchiym al mvoreshet gat vatey akheziyv leakhezav lemalekhey yisherael

Hebrew: עֹ֗ד הַיֹּרֵשׁ֙ אָ֣בִי לָ֔ךְ יוֹשֶׁ֖בֶת מָֽרֵשָׁ֑ה עַד־עֲדֻלָּ֥ם יָב֖וֹא כְּב֥וֹד יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
A dispossessor will I bring to you
Who dwell in Mareshah;
At Adullam the glory
Of Israel shall set.
Transliteration: od hayoresh aviy lakhe yvoshevet mareshah ad-adulam yavvo khevvod yisherael

Hebrew: קׇרְחִ֣י וָגֹ֔זִּי עַל־בְּנֵ֖י תַּעֲנוּגָ֑יִךְ הַרְחִ֤בִי קׇרְחָתֵךְ֙ כַּנֶּ֔שֶׁר כִּ֥י גָל֖וּ מִמֵּֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Shear off your hair and make yourself bald
For the children you once delighted in;
Make yourself as bald as a vulture,
For they have been banished from you.
Transliteration: kׇrechiy vagoziy al-veney taanugayiikhe harechiviy kׇrechatekhe khanesher khiy galu mimekhe {s}

Hebrew: ה֧וֹי חֹֽשְׁבֵי־אָ֛וֶן וּפֹ֥עֲלֵי רָ֖ע עַל־מִשְׁכְּבוֹתָ֑ם בְּא֤וֹר הַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ יַעֲשׂ֔וּהָ כִּ֥י יֶשׁ־לְאֵ֖ל יָדָֽם׃
Translated:
Ah, those who plan iniquity
And design evil on their beds;
When morning dawns, they do it,
For they have the power.
Transliteration: hvoy choshevey-aven ufoaley ra al-mishekhevvotam vevor havoker yaashuha khiy yesh-leel yadam

Hebrew: וְחָמְד֤וּ שָׂדוֹת֙ וְגָזָ֔לוּ וּבָתִּ֖ים וְנָשָׂ֑אוּ וְעָֽשְׁקוּ֙ גֶּ֣בֶר וּבֵית֔וֹ וְאִ֖ישׁ וְנַחֲלָתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated:
They covet fields, and seize them;
Houses, and take them away.
They defraud men of their homes,
And people of their land.
Transliteration: vechamedu shadvot vegazalu uvatiym venashau veasheku gever uveytvo veiysh venachalatvo {s}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנְנִ֥י חֹשֵׁ֛ב עַל־הַמִּשְׁפָּחָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את רָעָ֑ה אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹֽא־תָמִ֨ישׁוּ מִשָּׁ֜ם צַוְּארֹֽתֵיכֶ֗ם וְלֹ֤א תֵֽלְכוּ֙ רוֹמָ֔ה כִּ֛י עֵ֥ת רָעָ֖ה הִֽיא׃
Translated: Assuredly, thus said G<small>OD</small>: I am planning such a misfortune against this clan that you will not be able to free your necks from it. You will not be able to walk erect; it will be such a time of disaster.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar yehovah hineniy choshev al-hamishefachah hazot raah asher lo-tamiyshu misham tsaveroteykhem velo telekhu rvomah khiy et raah hiy

Hebrew: בַּיּ֨וֹם הַה֜וּא יִשָּׂ֧א עֲלֵיכֶ֣ם מָשָׁ֗ל וְנָהָ֨ה נְהִ֤י נִֽהְיָה֙ אָמַר֙ שָׁד֣וֹד נְשַׁדֻּ֔נוּ חֵ֥לֶק עַמִּ֖י יָמִ֑יר אֵ֚יךְ יָמִ֣ישׁ לִ֔י לְשׁוֹבֵ֥ב שָׂדֵ֖ינוּ יְחַלֵּֽק׃
Translated:
In that day,
One shall recite a poem about you,
And utter a bitter lament,
And shall say:
“My people’s portion changes hands;
How it slips away from me!
Our field is allotted to a rebel.
We are utterly ravaged.”
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu yisha aleykhem mashal venahah nehiy niheyah amar shadvod neshadunu chelek amiy yamiyr eykhe yamiysh liy leshvovev shadeynu yechalek

Hebrew: לָכֵן֙ לֹֽא־יִֽהְיֶ֣ה לְךָ֔ מַשְׁלִ֥יךְ חֶ֖בֶל בְּגוֹרָ֑ל בִּקְהַ֖ל יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Truly, none of you
Shall cast a lot cord
In the assembly of GOD!
Transliteration: lakhen lo-yiheyeh lekha masheliykhe chevel vegvoral vikehal yehovah

Hebrew: אַל־תַּטִּ֖פוּ יַטִּיפ֑וּן לֹֽא־יַטִּ֣פוּ לָאֵ֔לֶּה לֹ֥א יִסַּ֖ג כְּלִמּֽוֹת׃
Translated:
“Stop preaching!” they preach.
“That’s no way to preach;
Shame shall not overtake [us].
Transliteration: al-tatifu yatiyfun lo-yatifu laeleh lo yisag khelimvot

Hebrew: הֶאָמ֣וּר בֵּֽית־יַעֲקֹ֗ב הֲקָצַר֙ ר֣וּחַ יְהֹוָ֔ה אִם־אֵ֖לֶּה מַעֲלָלָ֑יו הֲל֤וֹא דְבָרַי֙ יֵיטִ֔יבוּ עִ֖ם הַיָּשָׁ֥ר הֹלֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
Is the House of Jacob condemned?
Is GOD’s patience short?
Has such been the practice?”
To be sure, My words are friendly
To those who walk in rectitude;
Transliteration: heamur veyt-yaakov hakatsar rucha yehovah im-eleh maalalayv halvo devaray eiytiyvu im hayashar holekhe

Hebrew: וְאֶתְמ֗וּל עַמִּי֙ לְאוֹיֵ֣ב יְקוֹמֵ֔ם מִמּ֣וּל שַׂלְמָ֔ה אֶ֖דֶר תַּפְשִׁט֑וּן מֵעֹבְרִ֣ים בֶּ֔טַח שׁוּבֵ֖י מִלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated:
But an enemy arises against My people.
You strip the mantle with the cloak
Off such as pass unsuspecting,
Who are turned away from war.
Transliteration: veetemul amiy levoeiv yekvomem mimul shalemah eder tafeshitun meoveriym vetach shuvey milechamah

Hebrew: נְשֵׁ֤י עַמִּי֙ תְּגָ֣רְשׁ֔וּן מִבֵּ֖ית תַּֽעֲנֻגֶ֑יהָ מֵעַל֙ עֹֽלָלֶ֔יהָ תִּקְח֥וּ הֲדָרִ֖י לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
You drive the women of My people away
From their pleasant homes;
You deprive their infants
Of My glory forever.
Transliteration: neshey amiy tegareshun miveyt taanugeyha meal olaleyha tikechu hadariy levolam

Hebrew: ק֣וּמוּ וּלְכ֔וּ כִּ֥י לֹא־זֹ֖את הַמְּנוּחָ֑ה בַּעֲב֥וּר טָמְאָ֛ה תְּחַבֵּ֖ל וְחֶ֥בֶל נִמְרָֽץ׃
Translated:
Up and depart!
This is no resting place
Because of [your] defilement.
Terrible destruction shall befall.
Transliteration: kumu ulekhu khiy lo-zot hamenuchah vaavur tameah techavel vechevel nimerats

Hebrew: לוּ־אִ֞ישׁ הֹלֵ֥ךְ ר֙וּחַ֙ וָשֶׁ֣קֶר כִּזֵּ֔ב אַטִּ֣ף לְךָ֔ לַיַּ֖יִן וְלַשֵּׁכָ֑ר וְהָיָ֥ה מַטִּ֖יף הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated:
If someone were to go about uttering
Windy, baseless falsehoods:
“I’ll preach to you in favor of wine and liquor”—
That would be a preacher [acceptable] to this people.
Transliteration: lu-iysh holekhe rucha vasheker khizev atif lekha layayiin velashekhar vehayah matiyf haam hazeh

Hebrew: אָסֹ֨ף אֶאֱסֹ֜ף יַעֲקֹ֣ב כֻּלָּ֗ךְ קַבֵּ֤ץ אֲקַבֵּץ֙ שְׁאֵרִ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יַ֥חַד אֲשִׂימֶ֖נּוּ כְּצֹ֣אן בׇּצְרָ֑ה כְּעֵ֙דֶר֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַדׇּֽבְר֔וֹ תְּהִימֶ֖נָה מֵאָדָֽם׃
Translated:
I will assemble Jacob, all of you;
I will bring together the remnant of Israel;
I will make them all like sheep of Bozrah,
Like a flock inside its pen—
They will be noisy with people.
Transliteration: asof eesof yaakov khulakhe kavets akavets sheeriyt yisherael yachad ashiymenu khetson vׇtserah kheeder vetvokhe hadׇvervo tehiymenah meadam

Hebrew: עָלָ֤ה הַפֹּרֵץ֙ לִפְנֵיהֶ֔ם פָּֽרְצוּ֙ וַֽיַּעֲבֹ֔רוּ שַׁ֖עַר וַיֵּ֣צְאוּ ב֑וֹ וַיַּעֲבֹ֤ר מַלְכָּם֙ לִפְנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיהֹוָ֖ה בְּרֹאשָֽׁם׃ {פ}
Translated:
One who makes a breach
Goes before them;
They enlarge it to a gate
And leave by it.
Their king marches before them,
GOD at their head.
Transliteration: alah haforets lifeneyhem faretsu vayaavoru shaar vayetseu vvo vayaavor malekham lifeneyhem vayhovah verosham {f}

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֗ר שִׁמְעוּ־נָא֙ רָאשֵׁ֣י יַעֲקֹ֔ב וּקְצִינֵ֖י בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הֲל֣וֹא לָכֶ֔ם לָדַ֖עַת אֶת־הַמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
I said:
Listen, you rulers of Jacob,
You chiefs of the House of Israel!
For you ought to know what is right,
Transliteration: vaomar shimeu-na rashey yaakov uketsiyney veyt yisherael halvo lakhem ladaat et-hamishefat

Hebrew: שֹׂ֥נְאֵי ט֖וֹב וְאֹ֣הֲבֵי (רעה) [רָ֑ע] גֹּזְלֵ֤י עוֹרָם֙ מֵֽעֲלֵיהֶ֔ם וּשְׁאֵרָ֖ם מֵעַ֥ל עַצְמוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: But you hate good and love evil.
Transliteration: shoneey tvov veohavey (rh) [ra] gozeley voram mealeyhem usheeram meal atsemvotam

Hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר אָכְלוּ֮ שְׁאֵ֣ר עַמִּי֒ וְעוֹרָם֙ מֵעֲלֵיהֶ֣ם הִפְשִׁ֔יטוּ וְאֶת־עַצְמֹֽתֵיהֶ֖ם פִּצֵּ֑חוּ וּפָֽרְשׂוּ֙ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּסִּ֔יר וּכְבָשָׂ֖ר בְּת֥וֹךְ קַלָּֽחַת׃
Translated:
You have devoured My people’s flesh;
You have flayed the skin off them,
And their flesh off their bones.
And after tearing their skins off them,
And their flesh off their bones,
And breaking their bones to bits,
You have cut it up as into a pot,
Like meat in a cauldron.
Transliteration: vaasher akhelu sheer amiy vevoram mealeyhem hifeshiytu veet-atsemoteyhem fitsechu ufareshu khaasher vasiyr ukhevashar vetvokhe kalachat

Hebrew: אָ֚ז יִזְעֲק֣וּ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְלֹ֥א יַעֲנֶ֖ה אוֹתָ֑ם וְיַסְתֵּ֨ר פָּנָ֤יו מֵהֶם֙ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔יא כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הֵרֵ֖עוּ מַעַלְלֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
Someday they shall cry out to GOD,
But they will not be answered;
At that time the divine face will be hidden,
In accordance with the wrongs they have done.
Transliteration: az yizeaku el-yehovah velo yaaneh votam veyaseter fanayv mehem vaet hahiy khaasher hereu maaleleyhem {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־הַנְּבִיאִ֖ים הַמַּתְעִ֣ים אֶת־עַמִּ֑י הַנֹּשְׁכִ֤ים בְּשִׁנֵּיהֶם֙ וְקָרְא֣וּ שָׁל֔וֹם וַֽאֲשֶׁר֙ לֹא־יִתֵּ֣ן עַל־פִּיהֶ֔ם וְקִדְּשׁ֥וּ עָלָ֖יו מִלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD to the prophets
Who lead My people astray,
Who cry “Peace!”
When they have something to chew,
But launch a war on those
Who fail to fill their mouths:
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah al-haneviyiym hamateiym et-amiy hanoshekhiym veshineyhem vekareu shalvom vaasher lo-yiten al-fiyhem vekideshu alayv milechamah

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן לַ֤יְלָה לָכֶם֙ מֵֽחָז֔וֹן וְחָשְׁכָ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם מִקְּסֹ֑ם וּבָ֤אָה הַשֶּׁ֙מֶשׁ֙ עַל־הַנְּבִיאִ֔ים וְקָדַ֥ר עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
It shall be night for you
So that you cannot prophesy,
And it shall be dark for you
So that you cannot divine;
The sun shall set on the prophets,
And the day shall be darkened for them.
Transliteration: lakhen layelah lakhem mechazvon vechashekhah lakhem mikesom uvaah hashemesh al-haneviyiym vekadar aleyhem hayyvom

Hebrew: וּבֹ֣שׁוּ הַחֹזִ֗ים וְחָֽפְרוּ֙ הַקֹּ֣סְמִ֔ים וְעָט֥וּ עַל־שָׂפָ֖ם כֻּלָּ֑ם כִּ֛י אֵ֥ין מַעֲנֵ֖ה אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
The seers shall be shamed
And the diviners confounded;
They shall cover their upper lips,
Because no response comes from God.
Transliteration: uvoshu hachoziym vechaferu hakosemiym veatu al-shafam khulam khiy eyn maaneh Elohim

Hebrew: וְאוּלָ֗ם אָנֹכִ֞י מָלֵ֤אתִי כֹ֙חַ֙ אֶת־ר֣וּחַ יְהֹוָ֔ה וּמִשְׁפָּ֖ט וּגְבוּרָ֑ה לְהַגִּ֤יד לְיַֽעֲקֹב֙ פִּשְׁע֔וֹ וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל חַטָּאתֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
But I,
I am filled with strength by the spirit of GOD,
And with judgment and courage,
To declare to Jacob his transgressions
And to Israel his sin.
Transliteration: veulam anokhiy maletiy khocha et-rucha yehovah umishefat ugevurah lehagiyd leyaakov fishevo uleyisherael chatatvo {f}

Hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ־נָ֣א זֹ֗את רָאשֵׁי֙ בֵּ֣ית יַעֲקֹ֔ב וּקְצִינֵ֖י בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הַֽמְתַעֲבִ֣ים מִשְׁפָּ֔ט וְאֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַיְשָׁרָ֖ה יְעַקֵּֽשׁוּ׃
Translated:
Hear this, you rulers of the House of Jacob,
You chiefs of the House of Israel,
Who detest justice
And make crooked all that is straight,
Transliteration: shimeu-na zot rashey veyt yaakov uketsiyney veyt yisherael hametaaviym mishefat veet khׇl-hayesharah yeakeshu

Hebrew: בֹּנֶ֥ה צִיּ֖וֹן בְּדָמִ֑ים וִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם בְּעַוְלָֽה׃
Translated:
Who build Zion with crime,
Jerusalem with iniquity!
Transliteration: voneh tsiyyvon vedamiym viyrushala͏im veavelah

Hebrew: רָאשֶׁ֣יהָ ׀ בְּשֹׁ֣חַד יִשְׁפֹּ֗טוּ וְכֹהֲנֶ֙יהָ֙ בִּמְחִ֣יר יוֹר֔וּ וּנְבִיאֶ֖יהָ בְּכֶ֣סֶף יִקְסֹ֑מוּ וְעַל־יְהֹוָה֙ יִשָּׁעֵ֣נוּ לֵאמֹ֔ר הֲל֤וֹא יְהֹוָה֙ בְּקִרְבֵּ֔נוּ לֹֽא־תָב֥וֹא עָלֵ֖ינוּ רָעָֽה׃
Translated:
Her rulers judge for gifts,
Her priests give rulings for a fee,
And her prophets divine for pay;
Yet they rely upon GOD, saying,
“ GOD is in our midst;
No calamity shall overtake us.”
Transliteration: rasheyha veshochad yishefotu vekhohaneyha vimechiyr yvoru uneviyeyha vekhesef yikesomu veal-yehovah yishaenu lemor halvo yehovah vekirevenu lo-tavvo aleynu raah

Hebrew: לָכֵן֙ בִּגְלַלְכֶ֔ם צִיּ֖וֹן שָׂדֶ֣ה תֵֽחָרֵ֑שׁ וִירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ עִיִּ֣ין תִּֽהְיֶ֔ה וְהַ֥ר הַבַּ֖יִת לְבָמ֥וֹת יָֽעַר׃ {פ}
Translated:
Assuredly, because of you
Zion shall be plowed as a field,
Jerusalem shall become heaps of ruins
And the Temple Mount a shrine in the woods.
Transliteration: lakhen vigelalekhem tsiyyvon shadeh techaresh viyrushala͏im iyiyn tiheyeh vehar havayiit levamvot yaar {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ בְּאַחֲרִ֣ית הַיָּמִ֗ים יִ֠הְיֶ֠ה הַ֣ר בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֤ה נָכוֹן֙ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ הֶהָרִ֔ים וְנִשָּׂ֥א ה֖וּא מִגְּבָע֑וֹת וְנָהֲר֥וּ עָלָ֖יו עַמִּֽים׃
Translated:
In the days to come,
The Mount of GOD’s House shall stand
Firm above the mountains;
And it shall tower above the hills.
The peoples shall gaze on it with joy,
Transliteration: vehayah veachariyt hayamiym yiheyeh har veyt-yehovah nakhvon verosh hehariym venisha hu migevavot venaharu alayv amiym

Hebrew: וְֽהָלְכ֞וּ גּוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֗ים וְאָֽמְרוּ֙ לְכ֣וּ ׀ וְנַעֲלֶ֣ה אֶל־הַר־יְהֹוָ֗ה וְאֶל־בֵּית֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְיוֹרֵ֙נוּ֙ מִדְּרָכָ֔יו וְנֵלְכָ֖ה בְּאֹֽרְחֹתָ֑יו כִּ֤י מִצִּיּוֹן֙ תֵּצֵ֣א תוֹרָ֔ה וּדְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה מִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated:
And the many nations shall go and shall say:
“Come,
Let us go up to the Mount of GOD,
To the House of the God of Jacob;
That we may be instructed in God’s ways,
And that we may walk in godly paths.”
For instruction shall come forth from Zion,
The word of GOD from Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vehalekhu gvoyim raviym veameru lekhu venaaleh el-har-yehovah veel-veyt elohey yaakov veyvorenu miderakhayv venelekhah veorechotayv khiy mitsiyyvon tetse tvorah udevar-yehovah miyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וְשָׁפַ֗ט בֵּ֚ין עַמִּ֣ים רַבִּ֔ים וְהוֹכִ֛יחַ לְגוֹיִ֥ם עֲצֻמִ֖ים עַד־רָח֑וֹק וְכִתְּת֨וּ חַרְבֹתֵיהֶ֜ם לְאִתִּ֗ים וַחֲנִיתֹֽתֵיהֶם֙ לְמַזְמֵר֔וֹת לֹֽא־יִשְׂא֞וּ גּ֤וֹי אֶל־גּוֹי֙ חֶ֔רֶב וְלֹא־יִלְמְד֥וּן ע֖וֹד מִלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated:
Thus [God] will judge among the many peoples,
And arbitrate for the multitude of nations,
However distant;
And they shall beat their swords into plowshares
And their spears into pruning hooks.
Nation shall not take up
Sword against nation;
They shall never again know war;
Transliteration: veshafat veyn amiym raviym vehvokhiycha legvoyim atsumiym ad-rachvok vekhitetu charevoteyhem leitiym vachaniytoteyhem lemazemervot lo-yisheu gvoy el-gvoy cherev velo-yilemedun vod milechamah

Hebrew: וְיָשְׁב֗וּ אִ֣ישׁ תַּ֧חַת גַּפְנ֛וֹ וְתַ֥חַת תְּאֵנָת֖וֹ וְאֵ֣ין מַחֲרִ֑יד כִּי־פִ֛י יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת דִּבֵּֽר׃
Translated:
But every family shall sit
Under its own vine and fig tree
With no one to disturb them.
For it was GOD of Hosts who spoke.
Transliteration: veyashevu iysh tachat gafenvo vetachat teenatvo veeyn machariyd khiy-fiy yehovah tsevavot diver

Hebrew: כִּ֚י כׇּל־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים יֵלְכ֕וּ אִ֖ישׁ בְּשֵׁ֣ם אֱלֹהָ֑יו וַאֲנַ֗חְנוּ נֵלֵ֛ךְ בְּשֵׁם־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ לְעוֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃ {פ}
Translated:
Though all the peoples walk
Each in the names of its gods,
We will walk
In the name of the ETERNAL our God
Forever and ever.
Transliteration: khiy khׇl-haamiym eilekhu iysh veshem elohayv vaanachenu nelekhe veshem-yehovah eloheynu levolam vaed {f}

Hebrew: בַּיּ֨וֹם הַה֜וּא נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֗ה אֹֽסְפָה֙ הַצֹּ֣לֵעָ֔ה וְהַנִּדָּחָ֖ה אֲקַבֵּ֑צָה וַאֲשֶׁ֖ר הֲרֵעֹֽתִי׃
Translated:
In that day
—declares GOD—
I will assemble the lame [sheep]
And will gather the outcast
And those I have treated harshly;
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu neum-yehovah osefah hatsoleah vehanidachah akavetsah vaasher hareotiy

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֤י אֶת־הַצֹּֽלֵעָה֙ לִשְׁאֵרִ֔ית וְהַנַּהֲלָאָ֖ה לְג֣וֹי עָצ֑וּם וּמָלַ֨ךְ יְהֹוָ֤ה עֲלֵיהֶם֙ בְּהַ֣ר צִיּ֔וֹן מֵעַתָּ֖ה וְעַד־עוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
And I will turn the lame into a remnant
And the expelled into a populous nation.
And GOD will reign over them on Mount Zion
Now and for evermore.
Transliteration: veshametiy et-hatsoleah lisheeriyt vehanahalaah legvoy atsum umalakhe yehovah aleyhem vehar tsiyyvon meatah vead-volam {f}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה מִגְדַּל־עֵ֗דֶר עֹ֛פֶל בַּת־צִיּ֖וֹן עָדֶ֣יךָ תֵּאתֶ֑ה וּבָאָ֗ה הַמֶּמְשָׁלָה֙ הָרִ֣אשֹׁנָ֔ה מַמְלֶ֖כֶת לְבַ֥ת יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated:
And you, O Migdal-eder,
Outpost of Fair Zion,
It shall come to you:
The former monarchy shall return—
The kingship of Fair Jerusalem.
Transliteration: veatah migedal-eder ofel vat-tsiyyvon adeykha teteh uvaah hamemeshalah harishonah mamelekhet levat yerushala͏im

Hebrew: עַתָּ֕ה לָ֥מָּה תָרִ֖יעִי רֵ֑עַ הֲמֶ֣לֶךְ אֵֽין־בָּ֗ךְ אִֽם־יוֹעֲצֵךְ֙ אָבָ֔ד כִּֽי־הֶחֱזִיקֵ֥ךְ חִ֖יל כַּיּוֹלֵדָֽה׃
Translated:
Now why do you utter such cries?
Is there no king in you,
Have your advisors perished,
That you have been seized by writhing
Like a woman in travail?
Transliteration: atah lamah tariyiy rea hamelekhe eyn-vakhe im-yvoatsekhe avad khiy-hecheziykekhe chiyl khayyvoledah

Hebrew: ח֧וּלִי וָגֹ֛חִי בַּת־צִיּ֖וֹן כַּיּֽוֹלֵדָ֑ה כִּֽי־עַתָּה֩ תֵצְאִ֨י מִקִּרְיָ֜ה וְשָׁכַ֣נְתְּ בַּשָּׂדֶ֗ה וּבָ֤את עַד־בָּבֶל֙ שָׁ֣ם תִּנָּצֵ֔לִי שָׁ֚ם יִגְאָלֵ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה מִכַּ֖ף אֹיְבָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
Writhe and scream, Fair Zion,
Like a woman in travail!
For now you must leave the city
And dwell in the country—
And you will reach Babylon.
There you shall be saved,
There GOD will redeem you
From the hands of your foes.
Transliteration: chuliy vagochiy vat-tsiyyvon khayyvoledah khiy-atah tetseiy mikireyah veshakhanete vashadeh uvat ad-vavel sham tinatseliy sham yigealekhe yehovah mikhaf oyevayiikhe

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֛ה נֶאֶסְפ֥וּ עָלַ֖יִךְ גּוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֑ים הָאֹמְרִ֣ים תֶּחֱנָ֔ף וְתַ֥חַז בְּצִיּ֖וֹן עֵינֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
Indeed, many nations
Have assembled against you
Who think, “Let our eye
Obscenely gaze on Zion.”
Transliteration: veatah neesefu alayiikhe gvoyim raviym haomeriym techenaf vetachaz vetsiyyvon eyneynu

Hebrew: וְהֵ֗מָּה לֹ֤א יָֽדְעוּ֙ מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת יְהֹוָ֔ה וְלֹ֥א הֵבִ֖ינוּ עֲצָת֑וֹ כִּ֥י קִבְּצָ֖ם כֶּעָמִ֥יר גֹּֽרְנָה׃
Translated:
But they do not know
GOD’s design,
They do not divine the intent:
They have been gathered
Like cut grain to the threshing floor.
Transliteration: vehemah lo yadeu macheshevvot yehovah velo heviynu atsatvo khiy kivetsam kheamiyr gorenah

Hebrew: ק֧וּמִי וָד֣וֹשִׁי בַת־צִיּ֗וֹן כִּֽי־קַרְנֵ֞ךְ אָשִׂ֤ים בַּרְזֶל֙ וּפַרְסֹתַ֙יִךְ֙ אָשִׂ֣ים נְחוּשָׁ֔ה וַהֲדִקּ֖וֹת עַמִּ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים וְהַחֲרַמְתִּ֤י לַֽיהֹוָה֙ בִּצְעָ֔ם וְחֵילָ֖ם לַאֲד֥וֹן כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Up and thresh, Fair Zion!
For I will give you horns of iron
And provide you with hoofs of bronze,
And you will crush the many peoples.
You will devote their riches to GOD,
Their wealth to the Sovereign of all the earth.
Transliteration: kumiy vadvoshiy vat-tsiyyvon khiy-karenekhe ashiym varezel ufaresotayiikhe ashiym nechushah vahadikvot amiym raviym vehacharametiy layhovah vitseam vecheylam laadvon khׇl-haarets

Hebrew: עַתָּה֙ תִּתְגֹּדְדִ֣י בַת־גְּד֔וּד מָצ֖וֹר שָׂ֣ם עָלֵ֑ינוּ בַּשֵּׁ֙בֶט֙ יַכּ֣וּ עַֽל־הַלְּחִ֔י אֵ֖ת שֹׁפֵ֥ט יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated:
Now you gash yourself in grief.
They have laid siege to us;
They strike the ruler of Israel
On the cheek with a staff.
Transliteration: atah titegodediy vat-gedud matsvor sham aleynu vashevet yakhu al-halechiy et shofet yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֞ה בֵּֽית־לֶ֣חֶם אֶפְרָ֗תָה צָעִיר֙ לִֽהְיוֹת֙ בְּאַלְפֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה מִמְּךָ֙ לִ֣י יֵצֵ֔א לִֽהְי֥וֹת מוֹשֵׁ֖ל בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּמוֹצָאֹתָ֥יו מִקֶּ֖דֶם מִימֵ֥י עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
And you, O Bethlehem of Ephrath,
Least among the clans of Judah,
From you one shall come forth
To rule Israel for Me—
One whose origin is from of old,
From ancient times.
Transliteration: veatah veyt-lechem eferatah tsaiyr liheyvot vealefey yehudah mimekha liy eitse liheyvot mvoshel veyisherael umvotsaotayv mikedem miymey volam

Hebrew: לָכֵ֣ן יִתְּנֵ֔ם עַד־עֵ֥ת יוֹלֵדָ֖ה יָלָ֑דָה וְיֶ֣תֶר אֶחָ֔יו יְשׁוּב֖וּן עַל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Truly, [God] will leave them [helpless]
Until she who is to bear has borne;
Then the rest of his kindred
Shall return to the children of Israel.
Transliteration: lakhen yitenem ad-et yvoledah yaladah veyeter echayv yeshuvun al-veney yisherael

Hebrew: וְעָמַ֗ד וְרָעָה֙ בְּעֹ֣ז יְהֹוָ֔ה בִּגְא֕וֹן שֵׁ֖ם יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑יו וְיָשָׁ֕בוּ כִּֽי־עַתָּ֥ה יִגְדַּ֖ל עַד־אַפְסֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
He shall stand and shepherd
By the might of GOD,
By the power of the name
Of the ETERNAL his God,
And they shall dwell [secure].
For lo, he shall wax great
To the ends of the earth;
Transliteration: veamad veraah veoz yehovah vigevon shem yehovah elohayv veyashavu khiy-atah yigedal ad-afesey-arets

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֥ה זֶ֖ה שָׁל֑וֹם אַשּׁ֣וּר ׀ כִּֽי־יָב֣וֹא בְאַרְצֵ֗נוּ וְכִ֤י יִדְרֹךְ֙ בְּאַרְמְנוֹתֵ֔ינוּ וַהֲקֵמֹ֤נוּ עָלָיו֙ שִׁבְעָ֣ה רֹעִ֔ים וּשְׁמֹנָ֖ה נְסִיכֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
And that shall afford safety.
Should Assyria invade our land
And tread upon our fortresses,
We will set up over that nation seven shepherds,
Eight princes of other nations,
Transliteration: vehayah zeh shalvom ashur khiy-yavvo vearetsenu vekhiy yiderokhe vearemenvoteynu vahakemonu alayv shiveah roiym ushemonah nesiykhey adam

Hebrew: וְרָע֞וּ אֶת־אֶ֤רֶץ אַשּׁוּר֙ בַּחֶ֔רֶב וְאֶת־אֶ֥רֶץ נִמְרֹ֖ד בִּפְתָחֶ֑יהָ וְהִצִּיל֙ מֵֽאַשּׁ֔וּר כִּֽי־יָב֣וֹא בְאַרְצֵ֔נוּ וְכִ֥י יִדְרֹ֖ךְ בִּגְבוּלֵֽנוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Who will shepherd Assyria’s land with swords,
The land of Nimrod in its gates.
Thus he will deliver [us]
From Assyria, should it invade our land,
And should it trample our country.
Transliteration: verau et-erets ashur vacherev veet-erets nimerod vifetacheyha vehitsiyl meashur khiy-yavvo vearetsenu vekhiy yiderokhe vigevulenu {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ שְׁאֵרִ֣ית יַעֲקֹ֗ב בְּקֶ֙רֶב֙ עַמִּ֣ים רַבִּ֔ים כְּטַל֙ מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּרְבִיבִ֖ים עֲלֵי־עֵ֑שֶׂב אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־יְקַוֶּה֙ לְאִ֔ישׁ וְלֹ֥א יְיַחֵ֖ל לִבְנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
The remnant of Jacob shall be,
In the midst of the many peoples,
Like dew from GOD,
Like droplets on grass—
Which do not look to anybody
Nor place their hope in mortals.
Transliteration: vehayah sheeriyt yaakov vekerev amiym raviym khetal meet yehovah khireviyviym aley-eshev asher lo-yekaveh leiysh velo yeyachel liveney adam {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֩ שְׁאֵרִ֨ית יַעֲקֹ֜ב בַּגּוֹיִ֗ם בְּקֶ֙רֶב֙ עַמִּ֣ים רַבִּ֔ים כְּאַרְיֵה֙ בְּבַהֲמ֣וֹת יַ֔עַר כִּכְפִ֖יר בְּעֶדְרֵי־צֹ֑אן אֲשֶׁ֧ר אִם־עָבַ֛ר וְרָמַ֥ס וְטָרַ֖ף וְאֵ֥ין מַצִּֽיל׃
Translated:
The remnant of Jacob
Shall be among the nations,
In the midst of the many peoples,
Like a lion among beasts of the wild,
Like a fierce lion among flocks of sheep,
Which tramples wherever it goes
And rends, with none to deliver.
Transliteration: vehayah sheeriyt yaakov vagvoyim vekerev amiym raviym kheareeih vevahamvot yaar khikhefiyr veederey-tson asher im-avar veramas vetaraf veeyn matsiyl

Hebrew: תָּרֹ֥ם יָדְךָ֖ עַל־צָרֶ֑יךָ וְכׇל־אֹיְבֶ֖יךָ יִכָּרֵֽתוּ׃
Translated:
Your hand shall prevail over your foes,
And all your enemies shall be cut down!
Transliteration: tarom yadekha al-tsareykha vekhׇl-oyeveykha yikharetu

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה בַיּוֹם־הַהוּא֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהִכְרַתִּ֥י סוּסֶ֖יךָ מִקִּרְבֶּ֑ךָ וְהַאֲבַדְתִּ֖י מַרְכְּבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
In that day
—declares GOD—
I will destroy the horses in your midst
And wreck your chariots.
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom-hahu neum-yehovah vehikheratiy suseykha mikirevekha vehaavadetiy marekhevoteykha

Hebrew: וְהִכְרַתִּ֖י עָרֵ֣י אַרְצֶ֑ךָ וְהָרַסְתִּ֖י כׇּל־מִבְצָרֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
I will destroy the cities of your land
And demolish all your fortresses.
Transliteration: vehikheratiy arey aretsekha veharasetiy khׇl-mivetsareykha

Hebrew: וְהִכְרַתִּ֥י כְשָׁפִ֖ים מִיָּדֶ֑ךָ וּֽמְעוֹנְנִ֖ים לֹ֥א יִֽהְיוּ־לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
I will destroy the sorcery you practice,
And you shall have no more soothsayers.
Transliteration: vehikheratiy kheshafiym miyadekha umevoneniym lo yiheyu-lakhe

Hebrew: וְהִכְרַתִּ֧י פְסִילֶ֛יךָ וּמַצֵּבוֹתֶ֖יךָ מִקִּרְבֶּ֑ךָ וְלֹא־תִשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֥ה ע֖וֹד לְמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יָדֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
I will destroy your idols
And the sacred pillars in your midst;
And no more shall you bow down
To the work of your hands.
Transliteration: vehikheratiy fesiyleykha umatsevvoteykha mikirevekha velo-tishetachaveh vod lemaasheh yadeykha

Hebrew: וְנָתַשְׁתִּ֥י אֲשֵׁירֶ֖יךָ מִקִּרְבֶּ֑ךָ וְהִשְׁמַדְתִּ֖י עָרֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
I will tear down the sacred posts in your midst
And destroy your cities.
Transliteration: venatashetiy asheyreykha mikirevekha vehishemadetiy areykha

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֜יתִי בְּאַ֧ף וּבְחֵמָ֛ה נָקָ֖ם אֶת־הַגּוֹיִ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר לֹ֥א שָׁמֵֽעוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
In anger and wrath
Will I wreak retribution
On the nations that have not obeyed.
Transliteration: veashiytiy veaf uvechemah nakam et-hagvoyim asher lo shameu {f}

Hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ־נָ֕א אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֹמֵ֑ר ק֚וּם רִ֣יב אֶת־הֶהָרִ֔ים וְתִשְׁמַ֥עְנָה הַגְּבָע֖וֹת קוֹלֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Hear what GOD is saying:
Come, present [My] case before the mountains,
And let the hills hear you pleading.
Transliteration: shimeu-na et asher-yehovah omer kum riyv et-hehariym vetishemaenah hagevavot kvolekha

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֤וּ הָרִים֙ אֶת־רִ֣יב יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהָאֵתָנִ֖ים מ֣וֹסְדֵי אָ֑רֶץ כִּ֣י רִ֤יב לַֽיהֹוָה֙ עִם־עַמּ֔וֹ וְעִם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל יִתְוַכָּֽח׃
Translated:
Hear, you mountains, GOD’s case—
You firm foundations of the earth!
For GOD has a case against this covenanted people—
A suit against Israel.
Transliteration: shimeu hariym et-riyv yehovah vehaetaniym mvosedey arets khiy riyv layhovah im-amvo veim-yisherael yitevakhach

Hebrew: עַמִּ֛י מֶה־עָשִׂ֥יתִי לְךָ֖ וּמָ֣ה הֶלְאֵתִ֑יךָ עֲנֵ֥ה בִֽי׃
Translated:
“My people!
What wrong have I done you?
What hardship have I caused you?
Testify against Me.
Transliteration: amiy meh-ashiytiy lekha umah heleetiykha aneh viy

Hebrew: כִּ֤י הֶעֱלִתִ֙יךָ֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וּמִבֵּ֥ית עֲבָדִ֖ים פְּדִיתִ֑יךָ וָאֶשְׁלַ֣ח לְפָנֶ֔יךָ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֖ה אַהֲרֹ֥ן וּמִרְיָֽם׃
Translated:
In fact,
I brought you up from the land of Egypt,
I redeemed you from the house of bondage,
And I sent before you
Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.
Transliteration: khiy heelitiykha meerets mitserayiim umiveyt avadiym fediytiykha vaeshelach lefaneykha et-mosheh aharon umireyam

Hebrew: עַמִּ֗י זְכׇר־נָא֙ מַה־יָּעַ֗ץ בָּלָק֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מוֹאָ֔ב וּמֶה־עָנָ֥ה אֹת֖וֹ בִּלְעָ֣ם בֶּן־בְּע֑וֹר מִן־הַשִּׁטִּים֙ עַד־הַגִּלְגָּ֔ל לְמַ֕עַן דַּ֖עַת צִדְק֥וֹת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
“My people,
Remember what Balak king of Moab
Plotted against you,
And how Balaam son of Beor
Responded to him.
[Recall your passage]
From Shittim to Gilgal—
And you will recognize
GOD’s gracious acts.”
Transliteration: amiy zekhׇr-na mah-yaats valak melekhe mvoav umeh-anah otvo vileam ven-vevor min-hashitiym ad-hagilegal lemaan daat tsidekvot yehovah

Hebrew: בַּמָּה֙ אֲקַדֵּ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה אִכַּ֖ף לֵאלֹהֵ֣י מָר֑וֹם הַאֲקַדְּמֶ֣נּוּ בְעוֹל֔וֹת בַּעֲגָלִ֖ים בְּנֵ֥י שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated:
With what shall I approach GOD,
Do homage to God on high?
Shall I approach with burnt offerings,
With calves a year old?
Transliteration: vamah akadem yehovah ikhaf lelohey marvom haakademenu vevolvot vaagaliym veney shanah

Hebrew: הֲיִרְצֶ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ בְּאַלְפֵ֣י אֵילִ֔ים בְּרִֽבְב֖וֹת נַחֲלֵי־שָׁ֑מֶן הַאֶתֵּ֤ן בְּכוֹרִי֙ פִּשְׁעִ֔י פְּרִ֥י בִטְנִ֖י חַטַּ֥את נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
Would GOD be pleased with thousands of rams,
With myriads of streams of oil?
Shall I give my first-born for my transgression,
The fruit of my body for my sins?
Transliteration: hayiretseh yehovah vealefey eyliym verivevvot nachaley-shamen haeten vekhvoriy fisheiy feriy viteniy chatat nafeshiy

Hebrew: הִגִּ֥יד לְךָ֛ אָדָ֖ם מַה־טּ֑וֹב וּמָֽה־יְהֹוָ֞ה דּוֹרֵ֣שׁ מִמְּךָ֗ כִּ֣י אִם־עֲשׂ֤וֹת מִשְׁפָּט֙ וְאַ֣הֲבַת חֶ֔סֶד וְהַצְנֵ֥עַ לֶ֖כֶת עִם־אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃ {ס}
Translated:
“You have been told, O mortal, what is good,
And what GOD requires of you:
Only to do justice
And to love goodness,
And to walk modestly with your God;
Transliteration: higiyd lekha adam mah-tvov umah-yehovah dvoresh mimekha khiy im-ashvot mishefat veahavat chesed vehatsenea lekhet im-eloheykha {s}

Hebrew: ק֤וֹל יְהֹוָה֙ לָעִ֣יר יִקְרָ֔א וְתוּשִׁיָּ֖ה יִרְאֶ֣ה שְׁמֶ֑ךָ שִׁמְע֥וּ מַטֶּ֖ה וּמִ֥י יְעָדָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Then will your name achieve wisdom.”
Hark! GOD
Summons the city:
Hear, O scepter;
For who can direct her
Transliteration: kvol yehovah laiyr yikera vetushiyah yireeh shemekha shimeu mateh umiy yeadah

Hebrew: ע֗וֹד הַאִשׁ֙ בֵּ֣ית רָשָׁ֔ע אֹצְר֖וֹת רֶ֑שַׁע וְאֵיפַ֥ת רָז֖וֹן זְעוּמָֽה׃
Translated:
but you?
Will I overlook, in houses of the wicked,
The granaries of wickedness
And the accursed short ephah?
Transliteration: vod haish veyt rasha otservot resha veeyfat razvon zeumah

Hebrew: הַאֶזְכֶּ֖ה בְּמֹ֣אזְנֵי רֶ֑שַׁע וּבְכִ֖יס אַבְנֵ֥י מִרְמָֽה׃
Translated:
Shall they be acquitted despite wicked balances
And a bag of fraudulent weights?—
Transliteration: haezekheh vemozeney resha uvekhiys aveney miremah

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר עֲשִׁירֶ֙יהָ֙ מָלְא֣וּ חָמָ֔ס וְיֹשְׁבֶ֖יהָ דִּבְּרוּ־שָׁ֑קֶר וּלְשׁוֹנָ֖ם רְמִיָּ֥ה בְּפִיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Whose wealthy are full of lawlessness,
And whose inhabitants speak treachery,
With tongues of deceit in their mouths.
Transliteration: asher ashiyreyha maleu chamas veyosheveyha diveru-shaker uleshvonam remiyah vefiyhem

Hebrew: וְגַם־אֲנִ֖י הֶחֱלֵ֣יתִי הַכּוֹתֶ֑ךָ הַשְׁמֵ֖ם עַל־חַטֹּאתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
I, in turn, have beaten you sore,
Have stunned [you] for your sins:
Transliteration: vegam-aniy hecheleytiy hakhvotekha hashemem al-chatotekha

Hebrew: אַתָּ֤ה תֹאכַל֙ וְלֹ֣א תִשְׂבָּ֔ע וְיֶשְׁחֲךָ֖ בְּקִרְבֶּ֑ךָ וְתַסֵּג֙ וְלֹ֣א תַפְלִ֔יט וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר תְּפַלֵּ֖ט לַחֶ֥רֶב אֶתֵּֽן׃
Translated:
You have been eating without getting your fill,
And there is a gnawing at your vitals;
You have been conceiving without bearing young,
And what you bore I would deliver to the sword.
Transliteration: atah tokhal velo tisheva veyeshechakha vekirevekha vetaseg velo tafeliyt vaasher tefalet lacherev eten

Hebrew: אַתָּ֥ה תִזְרַ֖ע וְלֹ֣א תִקְצ֑וֹר אַתָּ֤ה תִדְרֹֽךְ־זַ֙יִת֙ וְלֹא־תָס֣וּךְ שֶׁ֔מֶן וְתִיר֖וֹשׁ וְלֹ֥א תִשְׁתֶּה־יָּֽיִן׃
Translated:
You have been sowing, but have nothing to reap;
You have trod olives, but have no oil for rubbing,
And grapes but have no wine to drink.
Transliteration: atah tizera velo tiketsvor atah tiderokhe-zayiit velo-tasukhe shemen vetiyrvosh velo tisheteh-yayiin

Hebrew: וְיִשְׁתַּמֵּ֞ר חֻקּ֣וֹת עׇמְרִ֗י וְכֹל֙ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה בֵית־אַחְאָ֔ב וַתֵּלְכ֖וּ בְּמֹעֲצוֹתָ֑ם לְמַ֩עַן֩ תִּתִּ֨י אֹתְךָ֜ לְשַׁמָּ֗ה וְיֹשְׁבֶ֙יהָ֙ לִשְׁרֵקָ֔ה וְחֶרְפַּ֥ת עַמִּ֖י תִּשָּֽׂאוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Yet you have kept the laws of Omri,
And all the practices of the House of Ahab,
And have followed what they devised.
Therefore I will make you an object of horror
And the city’s inhabitants an object of hissing;
And you shall bear the mockery of peoples.
Transliteration: veyishetamer chukvot ׇmeriy vekhol maasheh veyt-acheav vatelekhu vemoatsvotam lemaan titiy otekha leshamah veyosheveyha lisherekah vecherefat amiy tishau {f}

Hebrew: אַ֣לְלַי לִ֗י כִּ֤י הָיִ֙יתִי֙ כְּאׇסְפֵּי־קַ֔יִץ כְּעֹלְלֹ֖ת בָּצִ֑יר אֵין־אֶשְׁכּ֣וֹל לֶאֱכ֔וֹל בִּכּוּרָ֖ה אִוְּתָ֥ה נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
Woe is me!
I am become like leavings of a fig harvest,
Like gleanings when the vintage is over,
There is not a cluster to eat,
Not a ripe fig I could desire.
Transliteration: alelay liy khiy hayiytiy kheׇsefey-kayiits kheolelot vatsiyr eyn-eshekhvol leekhvol vikhurah ivetah nafeshiy

Hebrew: אָבַ֤ד חָסִיד֙ מִן־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְיָשָׁ֥ר בָּאָדָ֖ם אָ֑יִן כֻּלָּם֙ לְדָמִ֣ים יֶאֱרֹ֔בוּ אִ֥ישׁ אֶת־אָחִ֖יהוּ יָצ֥וּדוּ חֵֽרֶם׃
Translated:
The pious are vanished from the land,
None upright are left among its people;
All lie in wait to commit crimes,
Every last one traps the other in a net.
Transliteration: avad chasiyd min-haarets veyashar vaadam ayiin khulam ledamiym yeerovu iysh et-achiyhu yatsudu cherem

Hebrew: עַל־הָרַ֤ע כַּפַּ֙יִם֙ לְהֵיטִ֔יב הַשַּׂ֣ר שֹׁאֵ֔ל וְהַשֹּׁפֵ֖ט בַּשִּׁלּ֑וּם וְהַגָּד֗וֹל דֹּבֵ֨ר הַוַּ֥ת נַפְשׁ֛וֹ ה֖וּא וַֽיְעַבְּתֽוּהָ׃
Translated:
They are eager to do evil:
The magistrate makes demands,
And the judge [judges] for a fee;
The rich one makes a crooked plea,
And they grant it.
Transliteration: al-hara khafayiim leheytiyv hashar shoel vehashofet vashilum vehagadvol dover havat nafeshvo hu vayeavetuha

Hebrew: טוֹבָ֣ם כְּחֵ֔דֶק יָשָׁ֖ר מִמְּסוּכָ֑ה י֤וֹם מְצַפֶּ֙יךָ֙ פְּקֻדָּתְךָ֣ בָ֔אָה עַתָּ֥ה תִהְיֶ֖ה מְבוּכָתָֽם׃
Translated:
The best of them is like a prickly shrub;
The [most] upright, worse than a barrier of thorns.
On the day you waited for, your doom has come—
Now their confusion shall come to pass.
Transliteration: tvovam khechedek yashar mimesukhah yvom metsafeykha fekudatekha vaah atah tiheyeh mevukhatam

Hebrew: אַל־תַּאֲמִ֣ינֽוּ בְרֵ֔עַ אַֽל־תִּבְטְח֖וּ בְּאַלּ֑וּף מִשֹּׁכֶ֣בֶת חֵיקֶ֔ךָ שְׁמֹ֖ר פִּתְחֵי־פִֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Trust no friend,
Rely on no intimate;
Be guarded in speech
With her who lies in your bosom.
Transliteration: al-taamiynu verea al-tivetechu vealuf mishokhevet cheykekha shemor fitechey-fiykha

Hebrew: כִּי־בֵן֙ מְנַבֵּ֣ל אָ֔ב בַּ֚ת קָמָ֣ה בְאִמָּ֔הּ כַּלָּ֖ה בַּחֲמֹתָ֑הּ אֹיְבֵ֥י אִ֖ישׁ אַנְשֵׁ֥י בֵיתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
For son spurns father,
Daughter rises up against mother,
Daughter-in-law against mother-in-law—
A man’s own household
Are his enemies.
Transliteration: khiy-ven menavel av vat kamah veimah khalah vachamotah oyevey iysh aneshey veytvo

Hebrew: וַֽאֲנִי֙ בַּיהֹוָ֣ה אֲצַפֶּ֔ה אוֹחִ֖ילָה לֵאלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׁעִ֑י יִשְׁמָעֵ֖נִי אֱלֹהָֽי׃
Translated:
Yet I will look to GOD,
I will wait for the God who saves me,
My God will hear me.
Transliteration: vaaniy vayhovah atsafeh vochiylah lelohey yisheiy yishemaeniy elohay

Hebrew: אַֽל־תִּשְׂמְחִ֤י אֹיַ֙בְתִּי֙ לִ֔י כִּ֥י נָפַ֖לְתִּי קָ֑מְתִּי כִּֽי־אֵשֵׁ֣ב בַּחֹ֔שֶׁךְ יְהֹוָ֖ה א֥וֹר לִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
Do not rejoice over me,
O my enemy!
Though I have fallen, I rise again;
Though I sit in darkness, GOD is my light.
Transliteration: al-tishemechiy oyavetiy liy khiy nafaletiy kametiy khiy-eshev vachoshekhe yehovah vor liy {f}

Hebrew: זַ֤עַף יְהֹוָה֙ אֶשָּׂ֔א כִּ֥י חָטָ֖אתִי ל֑וֹ עַד֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָרִ֤יב רִיבִי֙ וְעָשָׂ֣ה מִשְׁפָּטִ֔י יוֹצִיאֵ֣נִי לָא֔וֹר אֶרְאֶ֖ה בְּצִדְקָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
I must bear GOD’s anger—
Against whom I have sinned,
Until my cause is championed
And my claim upheld.
I will be brought out into the light;
I will enjoy divine vindication.
Transliteration: zaaf yehovah esha khiy chatatiy lvo ad asher yariyv riyviy veashah mishefatiy yvotsiyeniy lavor ereeh vetsidekatvo

Hebrew: וְתֵרֶ֤א אֹיַ֙בְתִּי֙ וּתְכַסֶּ֣הָ בוּשָׁ֔ה הָאֹמְרָ֣ה אֵלַ֔י אַיּ֖וֹ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑יִךְ עֵינַי֙ תִּרְאֶ֣ינָּה בָּ֔הּ עַתָּ֛ה תִּהְיֶ֥ה לְמִרְמָ֖ס כְּטִ֥יט חוּצֽוֹת׃
Translated:
When my enemy sees it,
She shall be covered with shame,
She who taunts me with “Where is this God of yours,
the ETERNAL One ?”
My eyes shall behold her [downfall];
Lo, she shall be for trampling
Like mud in the streets.
Transliteration: vetere oyavetiy utekhaseha vushah haomerah elay ayyvo yehovah elohayiikhe eynay tireeynah vah atah tiheyeh lemiremas khetiyt chutsvot

Hebrew: י֖וֹם לִבְנ֣וֹת גְּדֵרָ֑יִךְ י֥וֹם הַה֖וּא יִרְחַק־חֹֽק׃
Translated:
A day for mending your walls—
That is a far-off day.
Transliteration: yvom livenvot gederayiikhe yvom hahu yirechak-chok

Hebrew: י֥וֹם הוּא֙ וְעָדֶ֣יךָ יָב֔וֹא לְמִנִּ֥י אַשּׁ֖וּר וְעָרֵ֣י מָצ֑וֹר וּלְמִנִּ֤י מָצוֹר֙ וְעַד־נָהָ֔ר וְיָ֥ם מִיָּ֖ם וְהַ֥ר הָהָֽר׃
Translated:
This is rather a day when to you
[Tramplers] will come streaming
From Assyria and the towns of Egypt—
From [every land from] Egypt to the Euphrates,
From sea to sea and from mountain to mountain—
Transliteration: yvom hu veadeykha yavvo leminiy ashur vearey matsvor uleminiy matsvor vead-nahar veyam miyam vehar hahar

Hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֥ה הָאָ֛רֶץ לִשְׁמָמָ֖ה עַל־יֹשְׁבֶ֑יהָ מִפְּרִ֖י מַעַלְלֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
And your land shall become a desolation—
Because of those who dwell in it—
As the fruit of their misdeeds.
Transliteration: vehayetah haarets lishemamah al-yosheveyha miferiy maaleleyhem {f}

Hebrew: רְעֵ֧ה עַמְּךָ֣ בְשִׁבְטֶ֗ךָ צֹ֚אן נַחֲלָתֶ֔ךָ שֹׁכְנִ֣י לְבָדָ֔ד יַ֖עַר בְּת֣וֹךְ כַּרְמֶ֑ל יִרְע֥וּ בָשָׁ֛ן וְגִלְעָ֖ד כִּימֵ֥י עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
Oh, shepherd Your people with Your staff,
Your very own flock.
May they who dwell isolated
In a woodland surrounded by farmland
Graze Bashan and Gilead
As in olden days.
Transliteration: reeh amekha veshivetekha tson nachalatekha shokheniy levadad yaar vetvokhe kharemel yireu vashan vegilead khiymey volam

Hebrew: כִּימֵ֥י צֵאתְךָ֖ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם אַרְאֶ֖נּוּ נִפְלָאֽוֹת׃
Translated:
I will show him wondrous deeds
As in the days when You sallied forth from the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: khiymey tsetekha meerets mitserayiim areenu nifelavot

Hebrew: יִרְא֤וּ גוֹיִם֙ וְיֵבֹ֔שׁוּ מִכֹּ֖ל גְּבוּרָתָ֑ם יָשִׂ֤ימוּ יָד֙ עַל־פֶּ֔ה אׇזְנֵיהֶ֖ם תֶּחֱרַֽשְׁנָה׃
Translated:
Let nations behold and be ashamed
Despite all their might;
Let them put hand to mouth;
Let their ears be deafened!
Transliteration: yireu gvoyim veeivoshu mikhol gevuratam yashiymu yad al-feh ׇzeneyhem techerashenah

Hebrew: יְלַחֲכ֤וּ עָפָר֙ כַּנָּחָ֔שׁ כְּזֹחֲלֵ֣י אֶ֔רֶץ יִרְגְּז֖וּ מִמִּסְגְּרֹֽתֵיהֶ֑ם אֶל־יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ יִפְחָ֔דוּ וְיִֽרְא֖וּ מִמֶּֽךָּ׃
Translated:
Let them lick dust like snakes,
Like crawling things on the ground!
Let them come trembling out of their strongholds
To the ETERNAL our God;
Let them fear and dread You!
Transliteration: yelachakhu afar khanachash khezochaley erets yiregezu mimisegeroteyhem el-yehovah eloheynu yifechadu veyireu mimekha

Hebrew: מִי־אֵ֣ל כָּמ֗וֹךָ נֹשֵׂ֤א עָוֺן֙ וְעֹבֵ֣ר עַל־פֶּ֔שַׁע לִשְׁאֵרִ֖ית נַחֲלָת֑וֹ לֹֽא־הֶחֱזִ֤יק לָעַד֙ אַפּ֔וֹ כִּֽי־חָפֵ֥ץ חֶ֖סֶד הֽוּא׃
Translated:
Who is a God like You,
Forgiving iniquity
And remitting transgression—
Not staying angry forever
Toward the remnant of Your own people,
Because You love graciousness!
Transliteration: miy-el khamvokha noshe avon veover al-fesha lisheeriyt nachalatvo lo-hecheziyk laad afvo khiy-chafets chesed hu

Hebrew: יָשׁ֣וּב יְרַחֲמֵ֔נוּ יִכְבֹּ֖שׁ עֲוֺנֹתֵ֑ינוּ וְתַשְׁלִ֛יךְ בִּמְצֻל֥וֹת יָ֖ם כׇּל־חַטֹּאותָֽם׃
Translated:
[God] will take us back in love,
Quashing our iniquities.
You will hurl all our sins
Into the depths of the sea.
Transliteration: yashuv yerachamenu yikhevosh avonoteynu vetasheliykhe vimetsulvot yam khׇl-chatovtam

Hebrew: תִּתֵּ֤ן אֱמֶת֙ לְיַֽעֲקֹ֔ב חֶ֖סֶד לְאַבְרָהָ֑ם אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֥עְתָּ לַאֲבֹתֵ֖ינוּ מִ֥ימֵי קֶֽדֶם׃
Translated:
You will keep faith with Jacob,
Loyalty to Abraham,
As You promised on oath to our fathers
In days gone by.
Transliteration: titen emet leyaakov chesed leaveraham asher-nishevaeta laavoteynu miymey kedem
